intro: Cheiridopsis aspera, commonly known as the rough carpet grass, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant features dense clusters of small, fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It produces bright yellow flowers during the summer months, adding a striking contrast to its foliage. This hardy species is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
